summary: The America Works Act of 2025 aims to amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008, specifically focusing on work requirements for able-bodied adults receiving Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits. The bill proposes changes to exemptions from these requirements, including age, medical fitness, and parental status. It also addresses waivers for states with high unemployment rates and makes a conforming amendment to the Fiscal Responsibility Act of 2023.
